website_summaries.verdict: Novice cooks will love the Crock-Pot Express' simplicity, but experienced home chefs should look to Instant Pot for more flavor.
pros: The affordable Crock-Pot Express cooks food quickly under pressure
It's a competent rice cooker, slow cooker and sauté station
Its controls are simple to use and is easy to clean
cons: Its non-stick pot doesn't develop as much caramelization as the Instant Pot's stainless steel in sear mode

customer_reviews.title: I like it and it works well
customer_reviews.text: Have used it several times in first week. The pot scratched badly the first time I used it to steam with the steam rack. Can scratch with my finger nail. I like it and it works well, but the pot is an issue!
customer_reviews.author: bob peay

customer_reviews.title: InstantPot Exploded
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend to anyone!!! IT BLEW UP! We were steaming corn, the screen still read heat, we were cooking (luckily) on the other countertop and the lid exploded and all of the contents blew out. We had hot water splatter on a wall 6 feet away and on the ceiling. I got scalding water on my foot, thank goodness I still had shoes on or it would have been much worse. If we had been standing next to it, or heaven forbid had kids in the kitchen this accident would have been much worse. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the valve
customer_reviews.text: This was great the first few uses. After that the bobber valve just seems to hate sealing. It was taking maybe 3-4 attempts of redrying the bobber valve and trying again for the unit to seal and manage to heat up. As that was taking 20 mins, it defeated the purpose of an express cooker. Maybe mine was defective. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Louise T

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until the third use
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until the third use... non-stick coating started flaking off. I was using proper utensils (wood/plastic). As I was dealing with this issue, I noticed how very thin the coating actually was.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Teflon coating steamed off onto food.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the product the first two times I used it. The third time my chicken came out covered in black Teflon coating. It makes me afraid to use it for something like stew because you wouldn't know if you were eating Teflon or not. I just happened to be steaming plain chicken so it was easy to see that it was covered in black. I really wanted to get a lot of use out of this product and now I feel like I won't.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom for Christmas and it worked for just over a year. She loved it until the valve didn’t work and the pot no longer held pressure. She contacted the company, Crock-Pot, and they have given her a terrible runaround since January 2019. They made her pay for a new lid but when it arrived, it didn’t include the part she needed. She had to send it back and pay for shipping. I would not purchase again and Amazon should consider dropping this company.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Burkheimer

customer_reviews.title: Omg! Life Changer!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I decided to get the Crock Pot brand!! Known and trusted and cheaper price! I’m so in love with this product! So many Facebook groups to join and ask questions and get tips and recipes. Watch YouTube videos and learn the mistakes others have learned from. Do not be scared to use it! Just read the included instructions and Read recipes a few times to make sure you understand each step! Such flavor and so quick!! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: J Marcel

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical but this pot is so great. A roast in 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but this pot is so great . A roast in 1 hour , chicken for soup in 35 mins. All the meat so far tastes like it was slow cooked for hours. I’m so glad I got this now time to get rid of my old steamer and a few old crock pots. I was very lucky I got mine for 67.00 .
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first try
customer_reviews.text: Pure garbage. Opened it and got an e6 error immediately. Did not even get to use one time. Followed directions and let cool down and restarted 4 times getting the same error code every time. Tried 2 meals in it and neither one finished correctly without a code. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: mark flanders

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy...The pressure cooker worked great. We cooked chicken with it and it came out great. Sadly when we tried to use the slow cooker component it did not cook the food. We came home after 7 hours and the dish was just warm. It clearly had never got to the temperature required for slow cooking. Very disappointing as I ordered this for my wife to replace her Crock pot that recently stop working. We tried different settings and nothing would increase the temperature on the slow cook setting. This was a Christmas present and apparently it is too late to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 1/2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was the best thing to happen to my kitchen for 10 days straight. Now every time I cook with it I get an E6 error message. According to the booklet that means I don’t have enough liquid inside the pot. I got this error when cooking chicken noodle soup. The pot was 1/2 full. It doesn’t matter what I cook, I get an error message. I’m so broken hearted over this.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Lingering Taste inside Pot after meals
customer_reviews.text: I love using the pressure cooker for making meals in my home. The only down side is it doesn't have a manual button feature like the InstantPot. Also, after cooking meals that have strong seasoning, like chili and stews, there is a lingering taste and smell in the pot. My oatmeal has a slight chili taste in it because of this. I am not sure how to get rid of this taste.
customer_reviews.author: NTX13

customer_reviews.title: Received dirty item
customer_reviews.text: I love the item but i took it out the box and it had food residue on the outside and inside of device. I gave as a gift so i was embarrassed during the unboxing, makes it look like i gave them an (obviously) used gift! I’m not sure what i expected but i at least would have like it to be cleaned!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Love this! At first I was thinking about returning ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! At first I was thinking about returning because it wasn’t the actual brand name “Instant Pot” but I started using it and it does every thing an Instant Pot says it does. Food is done in a fraction of the time it normally takes. I love there is a crockpot option as well and a temp setting. It’s easy to clean. If you're on the edge of trying to decide between this one or the more expensive cooker go with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this pressure cooker. I couldn’t get myself to spend the top dollar on an instant pot, this is a good alternative. Only downside is it has a non stick pot instead of the stainless steel looking one instant pot has. So you have to worry not to scratch it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas and have used it every single day since! So many meals can be quickly made and as a full-time working mom, I am super pressed for time! Additionally, meats that I cook often that end up drying out easily and are typically tough (e.g., stew beef, boneless ribs) turn out incredibly tender and super delicious. As far as not having a manual button, that's no big deal! The beans/chili button functions exactly the same as a manual button, as you can adjust the time and pressure with this. I am in love with my Crockpot express and have been recommending it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked great one time. Now gives constant error E6... Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arnold

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I hate this contraption. Despite washing, the lid takes on the aroma of what was previously cooked, so whatever is currently cooking also has hint of carry over flavor. Try having a roast with cinnamon banana oatmeal flavor. Gross. Then, the recipes Ive followed, instead of creating moist luscious and tender cuts of meat, I get boiled shoe leather. Ive thrown everything away cooked in this machine. HATE HATE HATE THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: SLD33AZ

customer_reviews.title: Helping me adhere to a restricted senior diet!
customer_reviews.text: I chose Crock-Pot Express over other brands for the price, the nonstick inner pot, and my trust in the brand. Since I started using this wonderful device, the quality of my diet has increased dramatically. I am an old single man with dietary restrictions from kidney failure and congestive heart disease. The speed, convenience, simplicity and versatility of this super pot makes it easy to prepare meals that are better for me, freeing me from the impulse to rely upon unhealthy convenience foods and take-out. To anyone without access to a full kitchen, such as a student in a dorm, this unit would be invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Haight

customer_reviews.title: Love at First Use, Now the Honeymoon is Over
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely loved this product since I originally purchased it. With it being Crock-Pot brand I thought I was getting many years of product experience. I have since bought 3 additional ones to give at wedding gifts. The lining of the pot is nonstick and therefore does scratch. I have been attempting to replace the pot but Amazon nor Crock-Pot have a 6 qt replacement. Tried ordering a stainless steel from Amazon that said it would fit and it did, but the seal would not remain during the cooking process. Tried contacting Crock-Pot with no support from them. Looks like I'll be trashing this one and going with another brand that will hopefully support their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I don't think we have had a hot meal that hasn't been cooked on our stove since we bought this pot. From bacon and eggs to a complete pot roast dinner, veggies and all. Searing meat, pressure cooking pork chops, meat free meals, et.al. We live on a sailboat and we haven't 'cooked' any other way. Only 1 suggestion to the manufacturer is that the ring for the lid be raised about an eighth of an inch higher (3 mm) to make cleaning the locking rim easer to clean underneath. Other than that everything else is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Super Glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been hearing all of the praise for pressure cookers and specifically the Instapot. However $100 to try a product I’m not sure we’d really use was too steep. I had seen the Crockpot express advertised on tv. And when it showed up as deal for $49 we snatched one up. It has been amazing! We have made multiple new dinners in it and in so little time. I love this thing! I have family members with specific dietary needs and it has been so easy to find things we could make in a fraction of the time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It cooks amazingly fast meals and has ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It cooks amazingly fast meals and has taken out some of the stress for dinner time. I highly suggest trying some of the recipes by Two Sleevers. The cons? 1. The seal retains odor of whatever you cooked. I smell curry constantly now. 2. All of the recipes for baked/roasted chicken just result in a mushy, grey-ish chicken with gooey skin. 3. It doesn't have a manual time option like the Insta-Pot brand one. 4. The trivet doesn't have handles so lifting out whole chickens is impossible. But at a fraction of the price of the "Real deal" I am willing to compromise on the manual setting and purchase my own trivet with handles.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, won't heat up past warm. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, won't heat up past warm. I knew something was up when I tried to brown a roast but it would only get warm to the touch. I tried to pressure cook it, but again, the heat never got past warm. Eventually it timed out and gave me an error message. I rechecked all settings and tried again, no luck. Defective. Very disappointed, ruined our dinner. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: My Crock-pot slow pressure cooker stopped working after 6 months. When I called the warranty phone number in the owners guide, they told me they would email me a return label and once they received it back they would send me another one. I never got the label and when I tried calling back, I would get to a certain point holding for the next representative, then the phone would disconnect. It doesn't seem like I can return to Amazon either but I will try that next.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie MacPherson

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how I lived without this
customer_reviews.text: I avoided the Instant Pot phase because I thought it was...well...a phase. I was worried my dishes wouldn't turn out as well or I would be throwing away the art of cooking by using this. I was wrong. You can make super delicious and technical dishes in this as well. I have made up many recipes and so far none of them have gone wrong. Just follow recipes or if you make your own: use common-sense building techniques. If you don't know how to cook....just follow the recipes and don't ruin your food.
customer_reviews.author: EcoAmazonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Cooking hard boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: I use it to steam eggs into easy-to-peel hard boiled eggs. Just add 1/2 cup water to pot, place grill in bottom, place 1 to 12 eggs, close and lock lid. Set relief valve to left for high pressure steaming. Then set for 7 minutes on high pressure. After it times out ,turn it off and release pressure carefully. Then open lid and place pot in sink and start filling with cold water to cool eggs. I add ice to get them cold quickly. After 20 minutes I eat them or place in refrigerator for later.
customer_reviews.author: Richard from St Louis

customer_reviews.title: good but over techy
customer_reviews.text: worked well on a basic level, but don't have a use for most of the preset buttons. they should get back to basic and concentrate on providing easy to use time, temp and pressure settings. I also had to replace my first one (got at Target) it went bad after the first use. this one though is worked well a couple of times now and doesn't seem to get as hot underneath as the first one.
customer_reviews.author: az man

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months, it stopped working. I was trying to make rice and after it went through the cycle and finished, I open the lid and the rice was as how I left it. I hit the "rice" button again, and an error message "E4" popped up. So I unplugged it, waited about a minute, plugged it back in and it cooked the rice. I have to do that everytime. I cook rice at least once a week and its a guessing game as to if its going to cook or not.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, the reviews were good. I, honestly, don't see how. I purchased this over a year ago. Tried it a couple of times and didn't like it. I thought maybe it's just me. I got it back out to try a recipe I found. Nothing but E6 errors constantly. It's not too hot, and there's plenty of liquid. The food currently sitting in the pot is going in the trash because it will be so over cooked by if it ever decides to come to pressure. I'm on my 3rd error message so it didn't seem likely. I'm just going to get an instant pot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Multi use is very handy
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure I'd like it but I'm glad I have it. I like to slow cook but this came in handy when the potatoes were rock solid and everything else was ready to eat. So easy to change from slow cook to pressure cook. No need to put in dishwasher either. Cleanup is very easy with a little soap and warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Karmalitta

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a pressure cooker 2 times before it broke. The knob that controls the pressure on top of the lid broke in my hand while washing it. Now it is just a VERY expensive crock pot because it won’t seal. Realtives of mine have an instant pot and they have no problems with theirs, the pressure knop on it isn’t as flimsy. I would never recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Was dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: First run was to pressure cook ribs. Less than 2 minutes into the cycle up popped a E1 error code. This particular error code number isn't shown in the included manual. I restarted the pressure cook cycle and got the same E1 error code. An online search for the E1 error indicated a high temp sensor failure but not from Crock Pot Express website which didn't show mention of this error code. To Amazon's credit they accepted my reason for return along with a prepaid return shipping label. Additionally, to my surprise, Amazon shipped a replacement the next day w/o having first received the Crock Pot I took to a UPS store for return.
customer_reviews.author: Over50

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for pressure cooker alone,  but does everything!
customer_reviews.text: I love to pressure cook without having to monitor the pot! Quiet, completely automated pressure cooker! I also love being able to sear meat then switch to a slow cooker almost in the same pot! What is there not to love? Well...you do have to figure out how to adapt the automatic settings to your particular needs. A bit of a learning curve and referring to the instructions or Web site until it is second nature. But I love it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Kollasch

customer_reviews.title: It's so big!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at the Instant Pot Mini but ought this instead because it was bigger and cost less. As a single person, the 3qt Mini would have been wiser, but I regret nothing. I am still learning how to use it. I've made steel cut oats for prepared breakfasts all week. Yesterday I made 6 cups of rice and froze 2 cup portions for later use. I haven't tried the other settings yet, but I do like the non-stop coating for easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Davina Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Crock Pot does not carry replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: While the product is great, CROCK POT DOES NOT SELL REPLACEMENT SEALING RINGS! This makes the pot useless after the sealing rings get worn out. When I have contacted Crock Pot, they say they have no idea when they will have the sealing rings in stock.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before buying this pressure pot, but it gives me all the problems in the world. Every time I go to use it an cut it on, which ever setting I want it always gives me an error code. I have only been able to use this pressure pot once with it to work well. I am not sure if i got a defective one, but this thing never works for me and it has been a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot to cook with...
customer_reviews.text: I cooked a roast beef, potatoes, and carrots the first time I used it and the roast was magnificent. I got this from my Husband for Christmas and I love it and really enjoy cooking with it. Great product . The price is right and I would recommend this pot to all my friends and family. The quality of the pot is wonderful. I would definitely buy this again without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More time to program than others
customer_reviews.text: I love pressure cookers but this is by far my least favorite. I have an of buying them and leaving them places where I have stayed. (Travel job)This one was very difficult to figure out how to turn it on and get it to work, so the functionality is not as easy and you have to how much time to cook something yourself. Others just have buttons and are pre programmed. (ie: meat, soup, steam, vegetables etc)
customer_reviews.author: Mary Krick

customer_reviews.title: The item itself is fine, arrived in fine shape
customer_reviews.text: The item itself is fine, arrived in fine shape. The only issue I have is the small accompanying recipe book and directions flyer are woefully brief and don't give basic information about the use of the item. You have to kind of guess what settings there should be, should you add time to the pre set cooking time, and so on. I have figured some of it out by trial and error but I would have preferred a better guide. I ended up having to buy a cookbook at the book store.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Graham

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as an early Christmas gift to my daughter and her family. They absolutely love it. Come home from a long day at work and eat a home cooked meal within half an hour (maybe just a tad more occasionally)--very important with school age children in the house. It is often used twice a day with few if any leftovers for her family of 4. The nonstick liner makes for easy cleanups. Thought there might be a steep learning curve, as it looks a bit complicated, but they took to it very quickly. Might just have to buy one for myself--they rave about it so much!
customer_reviews.author: Skcrmom03

customer_reviews.title: To Good To Be True - And It Wasn't
customer_reviews.text: It has never worked. 1st time using it as a crockpot. I have used crockpots for 30 years. It didn't cook the carrots - they were raw. Luckily it had the pressure cooker mode. That saved that meal. (I was lucky the it worked that time) Next, tried the pressure cooker mode. Nope - Welcome to E6 world. Read the notes, let it cool down, and had it repeat all over again. E6, E6, E6!. Tried it one more time, just to be sure - E6 - my old friend, was back again. Sending it back. I worried that to many functions would be its downfall. I was right.
customer_reviews.author: John Caserta

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for a gift as I love mine so much. The UPS driver told me he delivers these all the time so asked his wife to order one. he said they love it and feels good each time he delivers one, knowing people will have the same reaction. The Crock Pot brand is unique in that it sautes. We use that feature a lot. Cook your unpeeled potatoes and eggs in shells in this thing and you will be creating the best potatoe saiad you've ever eaten. It tastes like....potatoes! Don't get me started on the beef stroganoff, stews, soups, rice and chops, etc., etc.
customer_reviews.author: TireTracksUpNorth

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful little tool! I've been looking for a while at pressure cookers, and this one was half the price of the instapot so I had to try it out. I love it, it's a perfect size for me (we bought a bigger one at costo initially but returned because it was too big and hard to use). I've used the pressure cooker method for making chicken soup, bone broth, and chili. I use the slow cooker with delay timer for meals to come home to. I cannot find anything that I don't like about it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: This little pot literally changed the way we eat
customer_reviews.text: We had heard a lot about the instantpot and others like it. I found this fellow on prime day sale back in 2018. The first we came defective and it took Crockpot 30 days to get us a replacement, but there were no qualms about it, they happily exchanged it after some troubleshooting. Fast forward a year and we now own multiple instant pots from different manufacturers. We cook almost everything in it. 1 pot, little mess, little cleanup and few dishes. We are eating healthier because its easy! The one complaint is the seal for the lid tends to hold odors. Nothing will take it out. Just plan on buying a replacement or two.
customer_reviews.author: Homebrew

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the food smell out of the gasket
customer_reviews.text: I've used it exactly once to make beef stew following their recipe, it was delicious but I can't get the smell out of the lid gasket. I've ran it through the dishwasher, soaked it in oxyclean, soaked it in vinegar, and it still smells nasty. I've contacted Crock Pot about it but meanwhile I won't cook with it again until I can resolve this smell. It's gross.
customer_reviews.author: MDWood1

customer_reviews.title: Speedy, simple, convenient, healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Speedy, simple, and convenient. I love throwing frozen poultry and meat in here along with fresh and/or frozen vegetables. It comes out amazingly. A favorite is making a healthy "shepherd's pie" using turkey sausage, cauliflower, carrots, and peas. I find the Crock Pot Express does not replace my rice-maker, but for many, many other things it is perfect. Also, a tip: my gasket seal stopped fully sealing after a while. I gently removed the gasket and flipped it upside down. Now my Crock works perfectly again. Try this before ordering more gaskets.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: To know this machine is to love this machine.
customer_reviews.text: The photo is the result of 30 minutes, including prep and cleanup. And all in one pot. Penne, eggplant and meat sauce.(Pork and Beef).. To know this machine is to love this machine. Don't be like me. I bought this a year ago and I was scared to use it. It looks complicated but it is really very simple to use. It is also a safe time saving great cooker. It does so much! It is a really great addition to my appliance collection, one that I use a lot. Very happy with this! The more I use this the more I learn.
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am really loving the Crock-Pot Express. I have made a few things and the flavors are amazing, not to mention the short time in which it takes to cook! It does come with a limited cookbook. I would like to find a good cookbook or more recipes online. You do have to take the time to read the instructions on how to use the cooker, but it's not difficult to use or program once you've used it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: New Mexico Gal

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Receive the defective item that have a lot of scratch inside the pot!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Better than instant pot
customer_reviews.text: We use this pressure cooker on a weekly basis. It saves us so much time on cooking. With our busy schedules its a great addition to our lives. My mother in law has a instant pot and the crockpot brand works just as good if not better than the instant pot. And its a great price too. We love ours!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: From 8 hours to under an hour...it's like a time machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom as a Christmas gift and man was it a good one! She cooked some ribs in under an hour that we're falling off the bone. I can't wait to see what else it can do!
customer_reviews.author: C. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I purchased it!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get and use my Crock Pot Slow Cooker/Pressure Cooker. I used it four times and always followed the directions in the booklet. The fourth time, the pressure outlet popped and steam shot out. I quickly unplugged it--avoiding the steam. When I tried to use it again, I get an E5 error. I contacted Crock Pot Customer Service a week ago and still have not received a response. Would NOT recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy King

customer_reviews.title: I prefer it to my Instant Pot
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be easier to use than my Instant Pot; not much easier, but somewhat. I really liked that it has a non-stick tub. So much easier to clean than the stainless steel of the Instant Pot. HOWEVER, the shortest high-pressure setting is 3 minutes. There are a lot of things I make that need only a minute or two of high-pressure cooking. That extra minute or two does make a difference for a lot of items.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R

customer_reviews.title: Most useful appliance in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our Crock-pot Express Crock. I've had the chance to use the Instant Pot and I find this to be comparable and better in some cases. Better than Instant Pot for: Cleanup - LOVE the non-stick surface. Instant Pot is better for: Manual settings - it allows any time or pressure setting. You have to finagle it with the Crock-pot. Searing works a bit better since it's stainless steel. Overall - WELL WORTH IT! We use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Purchases We've Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: We could not love this more! It does everything advertised and perfectly. We're thrilled with the product quality, ease of use, ecoomy (less expensive than Instant Pot but does exactly the same things), reliability, and meal results. Slow cookers have been around for a long time and pressure cookers for even longer -- this is the next step in their evolution and Crock Pot did it right! We've used this several times a week every week since it arrived. Again...Love It!
customer_reviews.author: New Wave Violet

customer_reviews.title: This is the most fun product I've bought in a long time
customer_reviews.text: This is the most fun product I've bought in a long time. My only complaint is that it is GIGANTIC and won't even fit in my bottom cabinets so I have to leave it on the counter and it takes up twice the space of a regular crock pot. It looks much smaller in the picture and I had to double check that I didn't accidently order a restaurant sized one! So so easy to use though!
customer_reviews.author: Dana C. Privette

customer_reviews.title: this product is fantastic. i originally bought this for a diet i ...
customer_reviews.text: this product is fantastic. i originally bought this for a diet i was on, but i loaned it out to my parents, who use it all the time. and man this thing works really good. they have used both the slow cook option and the fast cooking option. and both work flawlessly. this works much better than the old kind they were using. if you want to make a quick 2 hour dinner, just drop what you want to cook in there, and wait the 2 hours to fast cook/ and you will be ready to eat within that time period.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Time saver!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is nice and it does cook quickly. One thing I find is where I see recipes for the "Insta Pot" that say to set to the "manual setting"... I don't have a "manual" setting for this pot. So I have to go to one of the other settings and decrease the time. Some things only need to cook for 4 minutes but certain settings only go as low as 6 so I have to watch the pot. Other than that everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice - Have used it several times already. Love all the features. The only difference that I know of between this and an instant pot is the Manual function. This does not have the Manual option. But with a little googling I have figured out what auto settings I can use to make anything I want.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: This Pressure cooler is awesome. After researching between the actual Instant Pot Brand ...
customer_reviews.text: This Pressure cooler is awesome. After researching between the actual Instant Pot Brand and many other brands I settled on this one because of the awesome reviews! It’s easy to use and I have been able to make the same recipes off Pinterest that are for the Instsnt Pit and they turn out perfect! We use this at least 1-2 times a week and so glad I purchased this one!
customer_reviews.author: Zoellner18

customer_reviews.title: Not so much inlove with this
customer_reviews.text: While I love all the features, there are a few tings that I'm not pleased with. 1 is that the non stick pot has already started to wear off, and I have only used it 3 times and with no utensils other than the one it came with. 2. There is no 'keep warm' function on its own. Only if one of the other functions had been used first.
customer_reviews.author: Carol V.

customer_reviews.title: Best cooking gadget in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! Whether you call it a Crock Pot, or an InstaPot, or a 6 in 1, this cooker rocks! I make hard boiled eggs in 4 minutes. I can cook a stew, then turn around and cook perfect rice. I've done chicken, pulled pork, so tender it just falls apart. I have never used the slow cooker setting, but the pressure cooker is AWESOME. A neat thing is that you can also saute/brown, then cook, with out extra pans, or a big ole mess. Clean up is easy, and there is no splattering. And the best part, during the warm summer months, it doesn't heat up the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Never heard of this before the wife said she wanted one. Wow! use it all the time, has replaced the crock pot. One dish meals. We have made slow cooker meals, pasta dishes, Chinese, Indian, you name it. between the online recipes and the cookbooks for this, choices are endless. Even did a cheesecake in here. Great family time doing the food prep, throw everything in there (per the recipes!!), dinner in 5-10 minutes. Clean up is easy. Only complaint is storage: this thing is huge!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Vickinovac

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: You need to experiment with it before you rely on it for any meal of significance. Kept overcooking my rice until I found the sweet spot of low pressure for 5 min. Also it is moderately a pain to clean, need to get a soapy cloth and wipe the top out and inside the apparatus after use, although no scrubbing needed.
customer_reviews.author: Toko

customer_reviews.title: A life changer in the kitchen!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing to have in your kitchen! I have already made everything from Yogurt, steel cut oats, rice, a shrimp/potato boil, and chicken pho; all in RECORD time! This has every function as an All in One kitchen device, including slow cooking. I recommend this to everyone from college students to kitchen afficianados. Definitely a purchase you won’t regret.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Winfrey

customer_reviews.title: Fatally Flawed, don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: To say that this is a sore disappointment would be a severe understatement. We thought this was going to be a tool that help us save time for our busy family. Instead it turned into a two hour nightmare attempting to fix the E6 error. As it turns out the E6 error is a known product flaw by Crock Pot. Their solution was to send us another flawed item to try again. This Instapot knock off is not worth your time or your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the greatest things ever created
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest things ever created. So versatile - you can cook any way you like. Steam, pressure cook, slow cook and on and on. It almost eliminates the need for any other cooking vessel. The thing I'm most impressed with is how you can pressure cook meat so quickly, and the meat turns out very tender and juicy. Wasn't expecting it to turn out so well. Easy to operate. Easy to clean. Not one thing I don't like about the Crock-Pot Express.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ott

customer_reviews.title: Slow cook
customer_reviews.text: The "LOW" button does not work, it will not turn on. I have contacted manufacturer and all I get back is requests for more and more detailed information. I have told them what the problem is and supplied serial # as requestested and now they are asking for imprints on crock post and power cord along with purchase invoice. I have very poor mobility due to numerous surgeries on my spine and shoulder replacements which makes getting this info extremely difficult. Please help me with getting a replacement for this defective cooker.
customer_reviews.author: eileen

customer_reviews.title: Works great, love how fast it cooks
customer_reviews.text: Works great, love how fast it cooks. Only bad thing was that the inner pot already had a small chip in the nonstick finish
customer_reviews.author: F4 Industries LLC.

customer_reviews.title: No replacement steamer valve available
customer_reviews.text: I've had this cooker for over a year. I've really loved it for the most part, I use it once or twice a week. The only problem I've had is w/the steam release valve. The part that sticks out broke fairly early on so I super glued it back. I've had to do this several times, until it's no longer an option. Went to purchase a replacement and it's NOT available! This makes my pot useless!
customer_reviews.author: Stafford family

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! After hearing much hype I broke down and bought this. I did a little research and went with the CPE over the InstaPot due to price and reviews and the clincher...the non-stick pot in the CPE! (friends have complained that they really have to scrub theirs, mines a cinch to clean). The only weird thing is one of the first meals I made in it called for smoked paprika, and wow, the seal really still smells like that one spice even after washing. I've made dinner, soups and my favorite, homemade applesauce...10 minutes (1/2hour with pressure build-up) vs 5 hours in my crock pot! Treat yourself to one of these.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast, cleans up fast too!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It’s automatic so I don’t forget things on the cooktop? Things that used to take hours to cook right now take 45 minutes from start to finish. I love that it’s easy to clean. Having gone to Chef’s school I hard a difficult time deciding to get this but after watching my daughter-in-law use hers and, of course, eating what she’d made, convinced me.
customer_reviews.author: Donato P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, with all your favorite instant features.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing value for a versatile multi-cooker. I've been apprehensive about using a pressure cooker in the past, but this has been an amazing addition to my kitchen. I appreciate that this product is easy to use, includes thorough instructions and a recipe book with recommendations on cook times and dishes, and comes with all the features / programs of the popular Instant Pot without the high price tag. For all the options that the Instant Pot provides -- pressure cooker, slow cooker, rice cooker, steamer, saute, yogurt maker, warmer -- this product does, too. For half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: I love it Crock-Pot is a great brand
customer_reviews.text: On the run, short of time for super, or long time cooking this is it. I love it and use it over and over again. In 2 hours you can take a large roast from freezer to crock pot (pressure cooker) and have a roast shredding so tender and juicy. You can pressure cook so many meals in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Lula Stock

customer_reviews.title: I read reviews on several brands and this one was rated the best. I ordered on Amazon for less than half ...
customer_reviews.text: My youngest son loves to cook. He was given an old, old pressure cooker and loves how it works. I know the Instant Pot is the in thing. I read reviews on several brands and this one was rated the best. I ordered on Amazon for less than half of what it cost at the stores. I was surprised at how heavy and well made it is.
customer_reviews.author: valerie burns

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooker but be gentle cleaning...
customer_reviews.text: Great product considering the price is very reasonable compared to instant pots. Just be careful with the non stick coating on the pot, It’s great for clean up but can be chipped if not careful. I love this cooker, many recipes online for new users. If you are on the fence for a multi cooker, Crock pot is a good value compared to other multi cookers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M

customer_reviews.title: Must Admit I love It
customer_reviews.text: Must admit that I love this. It's easy to use, easy to clean and heats up quickly. I've made chili, pressure cooked meat, browned things and haven't had any problems at all. The one slight issue I did have was when the husband poured uncooked rice in without non-stick pot inside. Some of the rice (10 grains our of 1, 8 oz cup) went under the bottom heating plate. Had to remove the underside bottom slightly to get them out. Otherwise, fantastic pot! Planning to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Andie Yancey

customer_reviews.title: Extra Slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a old GE slow cooker, wanting a smaller footprint and a few options. The pressure cooker is a great option, and it worked well for me. The slow cooker though, it left my food looking like I had cooked it for 2 hours after having it on for eight. Turns out, you can only use about half of the capacity of the 8qt pot. Works fine, but the teflon comes off when you just look at it. Might consider a ceramic pot next time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after all the hype of the Instant Pot, but wasn't willing to put out the money. I have to say I have cooked 2 meals in the pressure cooker and have been extremely happy. I had owned a stove top pressure cooker years ago, but never replaced it after it broke. I also use my crock pot at least 3 times per week due to our busy schedules. So far no complaints. I did see some people talk about this not having a manual adjustment, but you can adjust time with certain settings, I have just made some conversions from recipes I have found online. This may be my new best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have in every kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Should be able to give 10 ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️ I have made so many different dishes in this that my husband wants me to cook almost daily now 😱😱😱😱 on second thought I give it 1 ⭐️ LOL I’m joking SO IN LOVE WITH THIS!!! Makes me feel so independent again!!! I cook everything in this!!!
customer_reviews.author: elefantaflaca

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooker! I leave it on my counter since I use it so often. This Crock Pot Multi Cooker is one of the best items I have bought. Less expensive than the instant pot and does exactly the same things. I tell everyone about it.
customer_reviews.author: smajew

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and no fear like the old type pressure cookers that were so touchy to figure out..
customer_reviews.text: The ease of using it and my son has been using it daily since he opened his gift on Christmas..He said it's the best kitchen appliance he has and everything comes out better than any pan he has ever used for veggies, rice is tops in this crock and would never be without one now..
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Multicooker is the best for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fagor multicooker before this multicooker. Crockpot brand is so much better at 1/3 the price. Fagor went out of business in the USA so I couldn’t even return it before the warranty date. Crockpot is a valued brand. Most recent rump roast was the best ever!
customer_reviews.author: E JoAnn Brown

customer_reviews.title: I love the pot
customer_reviews.text: I love the pot. It's going to take some getting used to. I bought it used but supposedly in new condition. It smelled like chili and had splatters of chili inside and out. I had to completely wipe and wash everything including to seal. Disappointed in the cleanliness
customer_reviews.author: Burke1323

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Rice comes out perfect (not burned on the bottom). I make yogurt once or twice a week (1/2 gallon up to a full gallon). This unit does a great job. I love that I can come home from work, throw some chicken, apple cider, a few red potatoes, some baby carrots, seasoning as I feel, push a couple of buttons, and 20 minutes later I have a meal. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Loved it til I  got the dredded E6 error!
customer_reviews.text: Love this until we started getting the dredded E6 error code. After the first time that is all we get no matter what we do and trust me we have put plenty of water in and still get the message. Sending back and getting an insta pot!
customer_reviews.author: Papa Berg

customer_reviews.title: ErrorPot
customer_reviews.text: The product, a knockoff of the popular Instant Pot, simply does not work. It overheats constantly, producing an "E6" error message, forcing the user to wait until it cools down and then gamble that it will work properly the next time. It's more of an ErrorPot than an InstantPot.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Leonardi

customer_reviews.title: No minor imperfections here!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on time but it had a huge dent. I knew it could have minor imperfections, but it was dented in about 3 inches long and on the other side it was dented as well. Plugged it in and immediately had an error light. Packed it up and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: LoriMoore31

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: Used this for soup, steam veggies, great for steamed eggs. The shells just slips off. Everyone is on the instapot hype. I found this to have more features for a great price. I purchased one for me and gave the other one away for christmas and everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: works very well but wouldnt buy again (thats just me= cause its almost as much work than my regular pressure cooker. but cant knock the quality .....I personally think its just a "one trick pony" ( and ponys are a lot of work)...would still recommend cause its well made
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fox

customer_reviews.title: ... this device 3 times and the results have been good each time
customer_reviews.text: I have used this device 3 times and the results have been good each time. I cooked CHICKEN with RICE, TURKEY BREASTS, and PORK CHOPS with RICE. The only complaint is that there is not an easy place to wrap the cord for storage and I don't want to put it inside for fear of scratching the POT. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: mmbntx

customer_reviews.title: I really love being able to cook Mills really fast
customer_reviews.text: I really love being able to cook Mills really fast. I made delicious baby back ribs last night in about 50 minutes. That included 10 minutes under the broiler after I brushed the barbecue sauce. The thing I don’t like is that all of the YouTube videos and most of the recipes online or for the actual Instant Pot. The pre-settings the Instant Pot are different then the pre-settings on the Crockpot cooker. You have to make adjustments to the Crockpot times a lot of the time. I want this to be as simple as possible so I will be selling my crockpot cooker And spending a little more money to get the actual Instant Pot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just don't
customer_reviews.text: There is a known defect with a certain lot of these. The pressure cooker feature produces an error message and doesn't work. We have tried many times to get a replacement from Crock Pot, but their customer service is less than adequate. So now we are stuck with an extra crock pot and no pressure cooker. I regret buying this on sale from Amazon when it first came out.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Gutting

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Easy to Clean!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this versatile cooker! We have already slow cooked a turkey breast and pressure cooked chicken and then yellow rice to go with it. Also, I have made the corned beef and cabbage recipe that is in the book for the machine! Wonderful cooker and easy clean up!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Salvaggio

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, easy quick. Big pot of pasta with sausage in 10 min after reaching pressure and one pot to clean. Cooked pork, chicken, cornbeef everything great. Look for cookbooks also, recipes with it very limited
customer_reviews.author: DaveyB

customer_reviews.title: They work just let it do it’s job
customer_reviews.text: I was a skeptic but when the old combination slow cooker rice cooker died I got this. The pressure cooker part is flawless. Just read the manual and heed the instructions. I have used it many times now. The slow cooker function does not seem to get very hot, but with this thing I won’t be slow cooking anything.
customer_reviews.author: Lance K. Mertz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only tried this using the slow cooker option. The locking lid keeps the contents (meat) much more moist and flavorful than my slow cooker with a glass lid. I made a pork tenderloin last night and it fell apart. Delicious. Plan to try out the pressure cooker option this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Gullo

customer_reviews.title: Slow Cooker - IS SLOW
customer_reviews.text: I think I like the pressure cooker, but the slow cooker - is slow. On low it hardly warms and takes a long time on high. A recipe that called for 4 hours on low took over 4 hours on high. If I had known it is not a reliable slow cooker I would not have purchased. Hope it holds up as a pressure cooker. I need to experiment with that.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: this is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: addicted to my pressure cooker! fast cook times, flavorful meals all so quick. THE SAME as instant pot, at a better price. only downside is the lack of a "manual" button that lets you select high or low pressure and how many minutes. you have to make due with the preset buttons. not a big deal. highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

product_meta.title: Crock Pot 6 Quart 8 in 1 Multi Use Express Crock Programmable Pressure Cooker, Slow Cooker, Sauté & Steamer | Stainless Steel (SCCPPC600 V1)
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Size:6 QuartMake mealtime even easier with the Crock Pot Express Crock Multi Cooker, an all in one appliance that’s always ready when you are. Whether you're prepping your meal in the morning to let it cook all day, or you need a fast, healthy home cooked dish in under an hour—this one pot pressure cooking multi cooker does it all!
feature_bullets: The Crock Pot brand, the leader in 1 pot cooking, introduces the Express Crock Programmable Multi Cooker, an all in 1 appliance that lets you Slow Cook, Pressure Cook, Brown and Sauté, or Steam
Eight 1 touch digital meal settings include Meat/Stew, Beans/Chili, Rice/Risotto, Yogurt, Poultry, Dessert, Soup, and Multigrain
Six quart non stick cooking pot resists stuck on food and is dishwasher safe, simplifying your cleanup

Designed with an airtight locking lid that stays sealed under pressure for added safety, a delay start timer that offers you the flexibility to start at a later time, and Warm setting to keep your food at the ideal serving temperature
Accessories include recipe book, steaming rack, and serving spoon; Dimensions: 13.6 H x 13.6 W x 11.9 L inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,814 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
